item.name: CLion
item.description: A smart cross-platform IDE for C and C++

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The highlights include:

  • In code assistance and navigation:
    • Fixed the regression that resulted in slow code completion.
    • Fixed the problem with compiler information collection failing and leading to code assistance not working.
    • Fixed the problem with corrupted indexes that caused Find In Files to show no results.
  • Fixed a few issues and a crash in Clangd.
  • Fixed the regression that caused the broken syntax highlighting and incorrect compiler information collection on CUDA projects.
  • Fixed issues with code re-syncing for remote Makefile projects.
  • Grazi and Copyright plugins are now bundled into CLion.

For more details, please see the blog post.

cpu_arch.error_message: This product is only available on x86_64 platforms.

feedback.text: Understanding the experience you had with our product will help us to make it better.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The highlights include:

  • C++ support:
    • Show consteval in Override/Generate dialogs and Structure view.
    • Generate Definition action no longer loses the requires clause of a constrained function.
    • Override action no longer drops trailing return type in cases when a function has overloads.
    • Override action no longer loses the constexpr virtual function.
  • Fixes for incorrect for formatting in some cases.
  • Debugger:
    • GDB 10.1 no longer crashes when printing a struct variable with a flexible array member.
    • GDB on macOS now works with remote targets.
  • Custom Build Application configuration now skips the Build step if the tool is not specified.
  • And more.

For more details, please see the blog post.

cpu_arch.error_message: This product is only available on x86_64 platforms.

feedback.text: Understanding the experience you had with our product will help us to make it better.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The highlights include:

  • CMake Presets:
    • Fixed an incorrect CMake macro expansion on Windows.
    • When inheriting the presets, the toolchain field is inherited.
  • Makefile projects:
    • Respect the character encoding value in all make processes.
    • Use custom make settings during make target extraction.
  • Formatting:
    • Support the case when the base indent is shorter than the tab size and CLion is configured to use tabs.
    • Fixed an incorrect "File is not opened in a workspace" error when reformatting the code.

For more details, please see the blog post.

product_overview.html_description:
CLion is a smart cross-platform IDE for developing in C and C++ built on the IntelliJ platform. It brings coding assistance, on-the-fly code analysis with quick-fixes, and safe and automated refactorings to C and C++ developers on all three major platforms (Linux, Windows, and macOS). It fits local and remote development workflows as well as the development of embedded systems.

Supported languages and technologies
C, C++, Objective-C, Swift, Rust, Python, CMake, Makefile, Gradle

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The highlights include:

  • Several issues in code completion were addressed, and it now works inside Google Test macros and the assert macro.
  • Structure View now includes qualified names for the member functions shown there.
  • The IDE no longer fails to execute a Google parametric test instantiation (INSTANTIATE_TEST_CASE_P) when the Instantiation Name is empty.
  • Fixed an issue with detecting the WSL environment on Windows 1909.
  • Fixed an incorrect macro expansion in CMake Presets.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
CLion 2021.3 has become an even easier-to-use, more customizable, and more comprehensive IDE for unleashing the power of C and C++.


  • More flexible and easier to configure toolchains
    • Docker toolchain
    • Support for custom compiler
    • Ability to initialize toolchain environment via script
    • For Windows users, System toolchain and bundled MinGW toolset
  • Project models
    • CMake: CMake generator UI, Ninja as a default generator for new projects, CMake 3.21.1, and CMake Presets v3
    • Makefile: the new Build directory option when configuring a project in CLion
    • Gradle: Gradle and Gradle Native plugins in CLion are now unbundled
  • Enhanced debugger:
    • Improved rendering in frames and variables views
    • View as Array for pointers
    • Parallel Stacks view
    • More information in the FreeRTOS thread view and support for Zephyr RTOS
  • Editor:
    • Type hints for deduced C++ types
    • Qualified names for the member functions in Structure View
  • Static code analysis
    • Call-context sensitive analysis and more powerful Lifetime analysis
    • New MISRA checks added
    • Clang tools (Clangd-based language engine, Clang-Tidy and ClangFormat) are upgraded to LLVM v14.0.0
  • The new Push All up to Here VCS action

Learn more about these and other changes on the What's New page.

item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The highlights include:

  • Project Model:
    • Fixed a few issues with the new CMake generator UI.
    • Fixed broken Makefile project loading when sudo was used for the compiler call .
    • Fixed the problem causing the STM32CubeIDE project build to fail if AzureRTOS middleware was used.
  • Toolchains:
    • Added redirect input support for the new Docker toolchain.
    • CTest is now supported for the new Docker toolchain.
  • Debugger:
    • Improved frame presentation in the debugger when ABI tags are used.
    • Fixed hangs in LLDB and GDB.
  • Code navigation:
    • If there are several implementations available, navigating from a declaration now takes you to the one that is part of the build configuration selected in the editor, if possible.

For more details, please see the blog post.

whats_new.full_html:
This update is focused on improving the new Remote Development functionality introduced in v2021.3:

  • Fixed the high CPU usage when idle: GTW-685.
  • It's now possible to use Gateway to open a project by symlink: GTW-720.
  • Open classes and the placement of tabs are now preserved between sessions: CWM-4048.
  • Fixed glitches that appeared when scrolling through long lists in tool windows: CWM-3679.
  • Fixed the unclickable pop-ups: CWM-4422.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The CLion 2022.1 release is focused on quality improvements.

  • Improvements for remote development
    • CLion now bundles the new remote development workflow with the thin client.
    • CLion now supports Space cloud dev environments.
  • Docker toolchain
    • You can now provide additional container settings, such as port and volume bindings.
    • Valgrind Memcheck now works with the Docker toolchain.
  • More powerful CMake support
    • CLion now automatically creates CMake Profiles for configure presets.
    • CLion now handles the --preset argument passed to the cmake command as expected.
    • CMake profiles can be reloaded sequentially if needed.
    • Additional generator options are provided in CMake profiles.
    • Block folding, brace pairing, and code block highlighting are supported for more CMake commands.
    • CMake 3.22 is bundled.
    • If your CMake project is taking a long time to reload, you can now visually inspect why with the new CMake Profiling feature.
  • Wider range of debugger options
    • The CUDA-GDB debugger can now be used in CLion.
    • Show integers as hex values and display alongside the original value now works for LLDB on Windows.
    • The Embedded GDB Server configuration can now reset the device at different stages.
  • Enhanced code analysis
    • You can now see a preview for intention actions.
    • Clang-Tidy and MISRA settings have been updated.
    • Code analysis is now more accurate.
  • Parameter and type hints in CLion are now more informative and accurate for modern C++ code.
  • A variety of UX improvements have made everyday IDE actions more convenient and powerful.

Learn more about these and other changes on the What's New page.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • Project models:
    • CLion can now report CMake build progress when the Ninja generator is used.
    • We fixed the regression with incorrect loading of environment variables from files in Run/Debug configurations.
    • When using the Ninja generator, CLion now uses the same default value for the -j flag (80% of available processors) as for Makefile generators.
  • Toolchains:
    • We fixed the regression on Windows that was causing paths to make executables and C and C++ compilers to be passed incorrectly when using remote toolchains.
    • When a Docker toolchain is created without configured servers, the auto-detected server is now preselected and the images are listed.
  • C++ language support
    • We made the Endless loop inspection more accurate.
    • We added support for C++23's if consteval.
    • Clangd-based navigation became more accurate now in CLion.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
Here are the main highlights:

  • The Rename refactoring was fixed and is now applied to the correct code range.
  • CLion now checks for changes in the environment after every CMake reload. This way the IDE will suggest that you clean the CMake cache and reload CMake when CLion decides it's necessary.
  • Ctrl+Click (On Windows and Linux) / Cmd+Click (on macOS) in the Git Log panel now works as expected.
  • The UI issue causing a truncated VCS in-editor menu has been resolved.

For more details, please see the blog post.

CLion is a smart cross-platform IDE for developing in C and C++ built on the IntelliJ platform. item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The CLion 2022.2 release brings more code insights to your fingertips!
  • Code Documentation
    • The Quick Documentation popup is now available in CMake scripts.
    • In C++ Code, the Quick Documentation popup shows:
      • The value of the expressions evaluated at compile time.
      • Enum values.
      • Whether a given struct or class declaration supports copy and move operations.
  • CMake integration
    • Qt-related commands were added to completion lists in CMake scripts.
    • You can now review CMake cache variables and update CMake options provided to the CMake command in a single table-based UI in Settings/Preferences | Build, Execution, Deployment | CMake.
    • Colorized output for the Ninja generator in CMake is enabled for CMake 3.24 and higher.
    • A new and more convenient naming scheme is used for the CMake profiles created out of CMake Presets in CLion.
  • Embedded Development
    • A new wizard helps with creating Embedded GDB Server run configurations with predefined GDB server arguments.
  • Debugger
    • In CLion on Windows, you can now configure symbol servers for debugging.
    • CLion v2022.2 bundles GDB v12.1 and LLDB v 14.
  • Static and dynamic analysis
    • Interval Analysis was implemented and is used as a basis for many new checks, including Array index is out of bounds.
    • Clangd in CLion correctly recognizes the -std=gnu++23 option.
    • A new Clang-Tidy widget helps to create and view the Clang-Tidy configuration for the current file.
    • Inspection settings in Settings/Preferences | Editor | Inspections now visualize the highlighting style.
    • Valgrind Memcheck integration is being updated with better reporting for the configuration issues.
  • Remote and Docker toolchains
    • When using remote development with local sources, CLion 2022.2 uses rsync to synchronize your deployment configuration.
    • To improve the performance of the compiler information collection when using a Docker toolchain, CLion now uses docker exec instead of run.
    • CLion now correctly picks the environment file from inside the Docker container.
Learn more about these and other changes on the What's New page.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • C++ support:
    • We added navigation to the base class from the template class.
    • We fixed the incorrect Condition is always false warning for string.find.
  • Toolchains:
    • The gencode CUDA compile options no longer break the code insight features in CLion.
    • For WSL toolchain, spaces in the path used by CLion no longer break the build.
    • CLion can now successfully collect compiler information and thus work correctly with IAR compilers for AVR and MSP430.
    • Emscripten CMake toolchain is now handled by the IDE correctly.
  • CMake:
    • ANSI colors produced in CMake MESSAGES are now correctly rendered in the CMake tool window.
  • Performance:
    • We fixed a freeze that happened for unguarded mutual #includes.

For more details, please see the blog post.

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • We've fixed several bugs in code analysis (the Unreachable code, Condition is always true, and Value is only assigned but never accessed warnings are no longer triggered incorrectly).
  • IAR language extensions are now supported in CLion.
  • Files can now be edited properly after the project has been recompiled.
  • When you develop remotely using the thin client in CLion, the JetBrains client rejoins the session after the Restart IDE action is called.
  • Performance has been improved when working with language injections.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
CLion 2022.3 provides a better user experience across the board, from projects with only a couple of C/C++ files to complex CMake-based applications.

  • CMake
    • Debug CMake scripts as regular code. Set breakpoints, step through code, and watch CMake variables and targets.
    • Code assistance in CMakeLists.txt
      • Customize fonts and colors.
      • Expand and collapse various code regions.
      • Code completion for find_package
      • CMake structure view.
      • Strikethrough highlighting of deprecated commands.
    • A new action to add a file to the existing CMake target
    • The ability to run CMake targets with root privileges
  • Initial support for C++20 modules (including code highlighting, completion, and navigation)
  • Linker Script (LD) language support
  • Support for IAR language extensions
  • The ability to compile and run a single C or C++ file without CMake or another project model
  • Clang-Tidy
    • An update to v16.0.0 with new checks and LLVM fixes
    • Updated Clang-Tidy settings with detailed documentation
  • Quick Documentation
    • The Quick Documentation popup now shows the size of the type.
    • The Quick Documentation popup now links to cppreference.com articles for standard functions and structures.
  • In the debugger, for functions returning non-void, CLion now shows the return value in the Variables view.
  • RTOS thread view for Azure RTOS
  • A new UI for testing in CLion
  • A new solution for synchronizing settings
  • Remote:
    • An alternative way to work with projects in WSL2 via remote development
    • Performance improvements for remote development with local sources
  • CLion now bundles all default web development plugins from WebStorm.

Learn more about these and other changes on the What's New page.

product_overview.html_description:
CLion is a smart cross-platform IDE for developing in C and C++ built on the IntelliJ platform. It brings coding assistance, on-the-fly code analysis with quick-fixes, and safe and automated refactorings to C and C++ developers on all three major platforms (Linux, Windows, and macOS). It fits local and remote development workflows as well as the development of embedded systems.

Supported languages and technologies
C, C++, Objective-C, Swift, Rust, Python, CMake, Makefile, Gradle

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
It has only been a few weeks since the CLion 2022.3 release, which brought a better user experience across the board, from projects with only a couple of C/C++ files to complex CMake-based applications.

There were several fixes that we didn't quite manage to get into the big release a few weeks ago, but they are now available in this update:

  • CUDA:
    • We fixed a crash in Clangd on CUDA projects which prevented inlay hints from working.
  • CMake:
    • CLion now offers CMake keyword completion for any keywords that may appear in the command.
    • We added a warning that's shown when a target name is incompatible with the linker.
    • We fixed the Reformat action for CMake and removed unwanted spaces.
  • Unit testing:
    • We added support for the new xml-format-version attribute from Catch2 v3.
    • We added the ability to use Tab to navigate through fields in Unit Test run/debug configurations.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • Reformat on save with ClangFormat works as expected again.
  • On Windows, CLion no longer breaks the project compilation with the Visual Studio toolchain when CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE is in use.
  • We fixed the incorrect code warning which happened for GCC toolchain on macOS.
  • Performance:
    • We improved the performance of the code analysis in CLion.
    • We improved the performance of parsing coverage results, which was slow when using remote mode.
    • For Docker toolchain, CLion now correctly captures the end of the background task execution.
  • The behavior of the Settings Sync plugin has been updated. Settings synchronization across different IDE products is now turned off by default and can be enabled via a checkbox in Settings/Preferences | Settings Sync.

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
CLion 2023.1 brings a solution for package management, takes your debugging experience to a new level, helps with QML coding, and includes a host of improvements for the new UI.

  • Debugger updates:
    • The ability to explore the underlying assembly code even when the source code is available (disassemble on demand).
    • A reworked Attach to Process… dialog.
    • Actions to suspend or resume individual threads to help debug multithreaded applications were added.
    • An enhanced memory view.
  • Integration with vcpkg.
  • Support for Qt Modeling Language (QML).
  • C++ support:
    • A new action to create a new C++ Module Interface Unit.
    • An updated Clang-Tidy checks options dialog.
    • Support for constexpr and several other other specifiers in Change Signature, Extract Function, and Extract Constant refactorings.
    • Experimental Clangd-based indexer to speed up the Find Usages action and produce more accurate results in C++ code.
  • CLion now emulates the terminal in the output console.
  • CMake updates:
    • Bundled CMake v3.25.
    • Support for CMake presets up to version 5.
    • New color settings for CMake.
    • Floating CMake reload notifications.
  • New UI updates:
    • A redesigned Run widget.
    • A new Dark theme.
    • New options to show hidden tabs and split tool windows vertically.
    • A new Compact Mode for smaller screens.
  • User Experience:
    • Full IDE zoom.
    • Multiple tool window layouts.
    • The new Remember size for each tool window option.
    • The ability to predefine the behavior of Actions on Save for new projects.
  • VCS:
    • VCS status in Structure View.
    • Improved code review workflow for GitHub.
    • Grouping and autocompletion for branches.
  • Updates to Markdown and Rust.

Learn more about these and other changes on the What's New page.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
CLion 2023.1 was released recently with a solution for package management, enhanced debugging experience, support for QML coding, and a host of improvements for the new UI.

We found a few issues in the release, which we've addressed with this new bug-fix update, CLion 2023.1.1. If you haven't upgraded to v2023.1, now is definitely a good time to do so!

  • Fixed an issue with the LLDB permissions on Ubuntu
  • Fixed an issue with the Rename refactoring of a local variable
  • Fixed JavaScript/TypeScript and some other issues caused by the new built-in QML support

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
CLion 2023.1 was released recently with a solution for package management, enhanced debugging experience, support for QML coding, and a host of improvements for the new UI.

We found a few issues in the release, which we've addressed with this new bug-fix update, CLion 2023.1.2.

  • CUDA projects can now be opened successfully in CLion with a Docker toolchain (CPP-31357).
  • We fixed the issue that prevented CLion from finding some headers inside a Docker toolchain, like in the example with ROS2 in this report.
  • We added support for comments in the CMakePresets.json schema.
  • The new disassemble on demand feature now works correctly with GCC 13.1.
  • We fixed the performance degradation caused by inlay hints to prevent the Go to Declaration action from hanging (CPP-32273).
  • We added support for doctest::may_fail().
  • Previously set window sizing is preserved after restarting the IDE on Linux (IDEA-313378).
  • The IDE no longer flickers when working on Linux using two screens (JBR-5417).

For more details, please see the blog post.

item.name: CLion
item.description: A cross-platform C and C++ IDE

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • Cyclic dependency in CMake presets no longer causes CLion's UI to freeze.
  • CLion no longer fails with CMake configuration in cases where the /we4067 MSVC compiler flag is used.
  • We addressed the issue that prevented the debugger from being launched successfully on MacOS with a Docker toolchain.
  • CLion now retriggers code completion correctly after a typed prefix has changed.

For more details, please see the blog post.

quality.description: For the prudent. A stable version with reliable performance
quality.name: Release

whats_new.full_html:
The main highlights include:

  • The issue with CMake presets inheritance has been fixed (CPP-33461).
  • We synchronized the editing of vcpkg.json through actions and through the vcpkg panel (CPP-31855).
  • The issue that caused the deletion of records from the list of local tasks has been fixed (IDEA-274672).
  • We fixed the issues that were causing the main menu groups to malfunction and not process actions correctly on macOS (IDEA-319117, IDEA-318603).
